FuncDef:
The pim single-tag forward enable command enables a QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface to forward single-tagged PIM messages.
The undo pim single-tag forward enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, a QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface is not enabled to forward single-tagged PIM messages.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface on the Router is connected to a downstream Router, run the pim single-tag forward enable command to enable the sub-interface to forward single-tagged PIM messages received from the downstream device.
Prerequisites
Multicast routing has been enabled using the multicast routing-enable command in the system view, and PIM-SM has been enabled on the sub-interface using the pim sm command.
Precautions
The pim single-tag forward enable command is mutually exclusive with the igmp enable and igmp static-group commands.
This command applies only to QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interfaces that are configured to terminate single-tagged PIM messages or are not configured to terminate any tagged PIM messages.
The pim single-tag forward enable command takes effect only when the QinQ/Dot1q termination sub-interface functions as the outbound interface.
After the undo pim single-tag forward enable command is run on a QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface, QinQ/dot1q outbound interface entries of the sub-interface fail to be delivered to the sub-interface, causing multicast traffic forwarding failures.
